results.title: Alcohol and drugs in the workplace
results.brief_description: An information and training video and accompanying trainer’s manual about alcohol and drug use in the workplace. Contrary to the popular perception that people with alcohol or other drug related problems are unemployed or disenfranchised, 60-70% are in full-time employment. Of all workplace accidents 20-30% involve people in an intoxicated state. This video aims to demonstrate the extent of the cost, both to industry and the individual, of drug and alcohol use in the workplace. It deals with the responsibilities of industry and co-workers, and outlines employee assistance programs that will help those suffering from dependency problems.

results.title: Alcohol
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Single Concept Drug Films”.
This film shows alcohol as a mood changing substance. It shows the effects of different levels of alcohol consumption, which can lead to coma and death in extreme cases. The film stresses that decisions to use alcohol are best left to the informed individual. Suitable for secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Albury: year round holiday centre
results.brief_description: A look at Albury, holiday and convention city, and its surrounding resorts. Shows the numerous amenities they can offer to the tourist or visitor. Points of interest seen are Lake Hume, Beechworth and its historic buildings and Mount Beauty and skiing at Falls Creek. No further credits available.

results.title: Albert Gleizes
results.creator_credit: Les Films du Cypres and Pierre Alibert
results.brief_description: Presents the painter who, early in his career, began experimenting with structure to rediscover form, which eventually led to Cubism. Successive treatments of one subject painted by Gleizes are compared in their cubistic development and the laws of painting, which Gleizes defined, are demonstrated through examples in his own work.

results.title: Albert Camus: a self-portrait
results.creator_credit: Fred Orjain, Learning Corporation of America and Georges Rouquier
results.brief_description: An examination of the writing and philosophy of Albert Camus. This documentary traces the genesis of Camus’ existentialism in his relationship to the geography and culture of Algeria. Born of French parents but growing up among Arabs, Camus’ exploration of the agony of human separation reflects his own dichotomous identity. This film also includes a filmed conversation with the writer in which he talks about his love for theatre, football and the importance of achieving personal happiness in a world in which we are condemned to suffer the agonising silence of the unknown Universe. Excerpts from his novels and essays are read throughout the film.

results.title: Albany whaling
results.brief_description: Recounts the history of whaling on Australia’s West Coast with rare footage from early twentieth century to the last whale to be taken by the Cheynes Beach company. Includes scenes of harpooning with the grenade-head gun and the confrontation of Dr Jim Cairns’ Greenpeace Group and Albany citizens who felt that closure would endanger their homes and livings.

results.title: Alaska: reservoir of resources
results.creator_credit: EB Films and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: This film depicts the timber industry in Aalska in its early stages. Also shows salmon fishing during the short Summer season when 100s of millions of pounds of fish are netted under government supervision. Within the two months of the fishing and canning season many millions of dollars are made from this production. Gold mining is also carried out using cannon jets of water. During the short Summer season a variety of products are produced on the farms.
